file_content.text: That was pretty exciting. I see why you do it.
Easy, now. I'm not going to hurt you, and you've got no call to hurt anyone here.
You've got control of the station, and that's fine by me. The Republic--they're crusading. I don't know what's gotten into them.
We could work something out.
Reinforcements are on the way. Let's hear what you've got.
Talk quickly.
It's obvious I'm not here for your benefit. Why aren't you running?
You seem cooperative.
The only thing my people have got on this rock are mines and reactors. When they try to blow one up, I take it personally.
What's your angle?
Because I've worked in this reactor for eleven years, and now some Republic yahoos want to blow it up. I'm on your side.
Here's the deal: I'll activate the guns we've got set up and give those commandos a warm welcome.
Then we run the reactor for you. You keep guards here, but when you leave the planet, we keep the station. Agreed?
Imperials will do this job. No one else can be trusted.
We don't need you.
Now that's just harsh. We Ortolans have a long history of high-quality work with extremely low overhead.
There they are! Get them!
Uh, since negotiations are over, I'm going to go break for lunch.
You provide the expertise, and the Empire will provide protection.
Agreed.
You won't be disappointed. Our team here takes a competitive wage with very cheap overtime.
There they are! Get them!
We can, of course, work out the contract a little later.
I guess you like to multitask.
All civilians need to evacuate the station. Step away from the console with your hands on your head.
I'm not going anywhere, skinny. This is the exact opposite of what the Republic stands for.
I said, step away from the console with your hands on your head.
Did you seriously sign up for the army so you could threaten Ortolans?
This is the best you have?
Mind if I butt in?
I hear if you wave that blaster around enough, someone might fight back.
Hey! Stupid!
Intruders! I've got intruders in the shaft room!
